item.name: 7 Wonders: Duel
item.comment: Good game ...we enjoyed our plays so far ...but I guess my prerelease excitement of this game over inflated my expectations ...it is good and a worthy addition to 7 Wonders Universe ...but not fantastically brilliant ...I expect this will be contrary to others opinions ...I think I just like heavier games more now ...but much much better than the main games two player variant by miles ...however it just feels a little better than a filler to us ...

item.name: Abaddon
item.comment: waiting for mine to arrive - but graded a 10 to off set the 1 given without explanation ...will review score when played the game...

item.name: Abyss
item.comment:
Sublime ...a perfect game for us ...
Art fantastic...game play clean and engaging ...box insert works...components spot on very well presented and great quality ...
A game that will has lots of replay value and looks stunning on the table ...
As I said at the beginging totally sublime...

item.name: The Agents
item.comment: KS 2 version all KS 2 extras less book smashed and counters you can have for free as no good to any one ...

item.name: Amateurs to Arms!
item.comment: Fantastic package - very impressive on opening the box - yet to play ... Rating based on contents not play to be revised when played ...

item.name: Among the Stars
item.comment:
Wonderful wonderful game ...2p plays much better with the entwife variant publish in the expansion rules ...
Excllent art work, clear and concise rules with loads of replay value in base game increased with the expansion ...

item.name: Android
item.comment:
I love this game so much ...it works for me ...an interesting mix of film noir crime and sci-fi ...I know there's a lot of criticism of it but I think its one of Kevin wilsons best games ...can't wait to see his new x-files game this summer ...
Deffo a love or hate it game ...
Top notch components FFG really did us favour with this game plus a silly thing really but I love the stiff covered rule book just adds a touch of panache ...great art work very thematic ...cleverly interwoven mechanics and quite an original game ...hard to say these days ...the rule book hints at an expansion I wonder if we will ever see it printed ??
I also love the mood mechanic of the characters gives the game a very interesting twist ...
If you can't get your chums to play I would highly suggest popping over to the file section and downloading Byron Campbell's solitaire rules set " Android: Hunters v2 ...
This man has provided a awesome solitaire rules set that works so well there 40 pages long but twenty are the rules and twenty are character profiles ...they are well written and I wish I could rate them in their own right ...

item.name: Antiquity
item.comment: Brilliant ...

item.name: ApocalypZe Card Game
item.comment:
Initial rating for components, rule book ...
Will review when I have sleeved the cards and tried the game ...
Initial first impressions are not looking too good sadly ...

item.name: Arcadia Quest
item.comment: As close to,perfection as I have seen in 30 years of gaming ...

item.name: Arkadia
item.comment: Played this multiple times and never baord with it ...very clever game with great components ...

item.name: Batman: Gotham City Strategy Game
item.comment: Loved this game enjoyed my session with it today and although only played two player it did have a great batman appeal to us ...

item.name: The Big Book of Madness
item.comment:
Excellent fun game ...with a insert which does not allow sleeving of cards very well ...and as card stock is not the best they will need sleeving ...
When will game publishers take into account that players like to sleeve their card games ?
There is huge amount of room to make space for sleeved cards it's not like everything is cramped up ...
Rating raised to 9 from 8 after repeated play ...

item.name: Blue Moon Legends
item.comment:
One of our all time favorite 2 player card games ...some of the best card art work ever ...
One tiny quibble ...wish they had kept the cards to size of original game ...it made them feel even more special ...
Plus it's the only time I wish FFG had made an effort with the box insert !

item.name: Bora Bora
item.wishlistcomment: Brilliant, brilliant my fav Feld to date - his games are maturing into to what I feel will be considered classics in the near future ...He has achieved the rank of no 1 eurogame designer for me with this new game ...

item.name: Bruxelles 1893
item.comment: Solid WP...lots to do ...theme meshes well and great components ...

item.name: The Builders: Middle Ages
item.comment:
Enjoyable little filler game nice production ...not much to think about but nice to add to several other fillers to have a short session but various games ...
Currently play with Splendor, port royal and this ...nice way to pass an hour with out hurting our brains too much ...

item.name: C. C. Higgins Rail Pass
item.comment:
I was really looking forward to this game being a train game fan ...sadly, poor rules ...in fact a classic example of how to write rules if you know the game and not for those who don't know the game ...some of the rules issues could have been helped with at least a few examples of play ...
Second, I can't really find the game in it ...
Thirdly, the game was described as highly interactive ...when questioned about this the designer stated that the interactive aspect was "scewage" well that's not my idea of an interactive game ...might be for some ...
Ah well an expensive white elephant I guess we live and learn ...

item.name: Cacao
item.comment:
Nice quick tile laying game ...very entertaining played two player several times now and each time only one point separated the winner from loser ...
Simple but clever mechanics and very well produced with an insert that actually works !
Nice game to add to my collection and a welcome rest from carcassone!

item.name: Carnival Zombie
item.comment:
Awesome co-op horror game ...beautiful atmospheric art work ...rules well ...the first thing one should do is go to file section and download second updated rule book and while you are there the FAQ file...but truely worth the effort of untangling some of the rules ( translation issues really not rule issues) ...
Six characters are always in play regardless of the number of players ...has several 'finales ' to end the game so loads of replay plus random draws each turn for the hoards ...so like forest Gumps box of chocolates you never know what you're going to get ...
Great effort from a small Italian publisher ...
Would have been a ten but for the rule book just took the total shine from that ten point score...

item.name: Caverna: The Cave Farmers
item.comment:
this game is a first class example of ...
1. Top notch production values for both cardboard and wooden pieces and tight design... 2. Excellently written rules concise, clear and readable.. 3. Great well balanced design and deep play-testing ...
in my mind this game should serve as an exemplar for all publishers who produce euros boardgames of this type. This is what its about and should provide to some of those companies using kickstarter to fund a game the standard they should be achieving ...no excuses it can be done ...

item.name: Circus Train (Second edition)
item.comment:
We love this game ...very good tight design and we play the game with optional rules I.e event deck etc both basic and advanced game are solid ...
VPG have produced some great games in there new posh editions and this is one of their strongest non-solitaire games ...

item.name: La Città
item.comment: One of my favorite earlyish RGG games ...

item.name: City of Iron
item.comment: Fantastic components ...great great deck builder ...a perfect example of how KS should work ....

item.name: Codenames
item.comment: Simple elegance ...what an excellent game ...proves that not all games need 40 page rule books to be challenging and fun ...

item.name: Conquest of Planet Earth: The Space Alien Game
Coup + Coup: Reformation
item.comment:
Stunning version of this excellent game ...
Box is beautiful and metal coins well made ...greta card art plus expansion ...
Tight squeeze in box with sleeves only negative
I have box numbered 042

item.name: Dark Darker Darkest
item.comment:
Awesome game ...some very very clever mechanics ...a few issues with print errors ...but game exceptionally well supported by the designer ...
Without doubt my no 1 zombie game ...this game has intelligence ...you have a purpose and you need to think beyond knocking off heads ...
It's on my zombie gaming pedestal going to take an awesome game to knock it off ...

item.name: Dawn of the Zeds (Second edition)
item.comment: Another top state of siege game from VPG very rapidly becoming my solitaire games of choice ...

item.name: Dead Men Tell No Tales
item.comment: Great fun ...on a par with pandemic for us ...great components,mexcellent art and a very tight not so easy game to beat ...

item.name: Dead of Winter: A Crossroads Game
item.comment:
What an awesome game ...
Three games this year have really rocked my boat and have been three of my best games of the last decade nameley:
Dead of Winter Alien: Legendary Shadows of Brimstone
So many clever mechanics in this game, well,produced well,supported and can be played very well solitaire especially if you choose your actions first then draw your crossroad card then carry out the actions ...that way the crossroad card will not influence your choice of actions. A very simple way of making the game very solitaire friendly using multiple characters.

item.name: Deus
item.comment: Nice game, nice pieces nice rules ...nice over all but for some reason just misses the ten for me and I can't figure out why yet ...maybe I am still very excited about my new Flying Frog Game and other games are not quite upto Brimstone ...I know it's apples and pairs but it's how I feel ATM

item.name: Discoveries
item.comment: Great game ...played 2p and enjoyed it very much ...

item.name: Domaine
item.comment: Revisited after a long break and game came across as fresh and an excellent experience ...

item.name: Dominare
item.comment:
Sadly very underrated here on geek ...it's actually a very good game two player and shines 3-4 not played more than four ...
Stunning art work, great components very solid euro ...

item.name: Elysium
item.comment: Awesome card driven game ...

item.name: Eminent Domain: Escalation
item.comment:
This is what an expansion should be !
Brilliant !!!

item.name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple
item.comment:
Sceptical at first ...brought in late plus two expansions oh my what fantastic fun ...at my age can't think of anything more fun in ten minutes ;-)
The official challenges file makes for a brilliant campaign structured game too ...
Great fun and so replayable ...like a nice sci-fi themed version now !

item.name: Evolution
item.comment: After waiting so long for this ...it sadly fell very flat ...will try it again after we have played a few other games but sadly very anticlimactic ...

item.name: Firefly: The Game
item.comment:
Certainly one of the better licence to board game conversions ...rules are a bit loose and really a new edition of the rule book might be a good idea in order to assimilate the 7-9 pages of FAQ ...
Game play is pick up and drop off ...but could really do with a lot more PvP content not necessarily combat orientated per se ...
Overal though captures the firefly feel ...which to ardent fans like me is almost as important as game play ...
Issues with expansion card sizes as well ...thank goodness for sleeves ...

item.name: Firefly: The Game – Pirates & Bounty Hunters
item.comment:
Wow this finally rounds the circle and adds some very clever PvP to the game ...now it will really change the level of player interaction ...bounty hunters, boarding marvellous stuff ...it feels like a complete game now ...
Nice two additional ships ...both at either extreme one seriously fast raider type ship for hit and runes on OPs and the other a serious cargo vessel ideal for moving vast amounts of stuff over the verse ...
Very good expansion some extras goodies for the various cities more chits ...the goal numbers are very useful as it enables the instant id of goal location and priority on the map ...nice but simple touch ...
Ship models same standard as the first ships but bigger and smaller smaller for the fast ship and bigger for the cargo carrier ...

item.name: Five Tribes
item.comment:
Awesome game excellent at 2,3,4 players...
Raised from 9 to 10 after multiple plays ...
Happy with slave cards ...not happy with the mix of fakirs and slave cards ...
A real let down for early adopters ...
Just goes to show the squeeky wheel gets the oil again ...

item.name: Food Chain Magnate
item.comment:
Latest release from Splotter ...another classic in the making ...top quality components ...top quality game play that I suspect mirrors the trials and tribulations of the fast food industry...only this game will not make you fat, give you type 2 diabeties or metabolic syndrome...unless of course you want to stuff yourself with said products whilst playing this game ...
Only thing missing is the chemist milestone ...after all most fast food starts its life as a series of chemicals in a lab ...not a kitchen ...

item.name: Fortune and Glory: The Cliffhanger Game
Freedom: The Underground Railroad
item.comment:
When I first mentioned this game to my best gaming partner who also happens to be wife ...she looked at me and said "that's a bit of a sick subject to be gaming about is it not ? " and bearing in mind I have many many war games and she has never passed such a comment before...but once I showed her the game, explained the rules etc she came round and we both now feel this game has not only a brilliant design, it also has turned into one of the best co-ops we have played it has been extremely educational for us both and as a result have looked more into American Slavery and the abolitionist movement ...
A brilliant design with a very sensitive treatment of this subject... And very good top notch components ...

item.name: Galactic Strike Force
item.comment:
Awesome game and overall a brilliantly produced package I have base game, miniatures and expansion.
Very well produced, great back ground clever game mechanics and a worthy follow up from sentinels ...
One issue ...rule book too big and not very well written it kinda let's the whole package down the FAQ doc is a must if you want to truely make sense of the game ...
Some have said its fiddly I did not find this played a hell,of a lot more fiddly ...
I have solitaire using two decks ( ships) ...
Each alien/ scenario is pretty diverse and this game leaves no quarter so be prepared to die lol...
But who wants a walk in the park ??
Would have rated a ten but rule book was not good enough really ...

item.name: Galaxy Defenders
item.comment: Absolutely amazing game ...

item.name: The Game on Fire (compilation)
item.comment:
Got this ...not worth the extra money ...the player mat not worth a fart ...cheaper to buy main game in box takes up less room the a huge tube with cheap nasty player Matt ...very disappointed ...not recommended ...
Save your money
The three is for the game ...I don't like rating for components but this is a rip off ...
Hanabi much much better game ...

item.name: Gears of War: The Board Game
Glory to Rome
item.comment: Best ever card multi-role / action I have played ...

item.name: Grand Austria Hotel
item.comment: Excellent game ...loses one point for type face on staff cards ...very hard to read ...

item.name: Guildhall
item.comment:
I adore the simplicity of this game and even better with the new professions ...my wife and I play his loads and loads as it can be as cutthroat as you wish ...
Great presentation and good card stock an all round winner in my books well done AEG ...

item.name: Guildhall: Job Faire
item.comment:
I adore the simplicity of this game and even better with the new professions ...my wife and I play his loads and loads as it can be as cutthroat as you wish ...
Great presentation and good card stock an all round winner in my books well done AEG ...

item.name: Hegemonic
item.comment:
A ten for me ...this has been the 4x game I have been looking for ...
Great deep strategic play ...but fairly rules lite but clear well written rules...awesome components ...the player boards are brilliant and well thought out ...marvellous plastic components with great choice of colours...good use of iconography too...
Cards good quality ...art work and background well thought out and interesting ...has a euro play style but feels 4x ...
I am just in love with this game and my game of the year so far and anticipate playing it loads more ...
Also room for expansions if designer has the urge ...plus very well supported by the designer ...100% package ...

item.name: The Hunters: German U-Boats at War, 1939-43
item.comment: Want to give it a full ten but errata, and size of counters stop me ...very good game ...even better with some of the geek gamers extras in the file section ...

item.name: Imperial Settlers
item.comment:
Another 10 for another game of Portal awesomeness !
Excellent 2 player game although it plays upto four...it also has a strong solitaire game ...I will only ever play either solitaire or 2p so can't comment on how it plays with more than 2 players.
One of the most exciting aspects is the promised periodic releases of expansions for the game through the introduction of more cards along with new civilisations this will only be a good thing ...adding more variety, and a bit of deck building/ tweaking marvellous !
Art and components ...the art will annoy some or them off the game because of its slightly comic cartoonish nature ...I happen to love this type of art...so it's a solid plus for me ...as to the components ...well here I have two downers, and they are both related to the cards...and when I say downers that's probally over stating it, as I have rated this game a deserving ten...the font size on the cards could do with coming up a couple of notches which I am sure can be done with future card releases if publisher desires it ...and the card stock ...this has always in my opinion been a slight failing in Portal games ...please please move onto linen finished cards it feels and works much better... I know it might be a tad more expensive but I would rather pay a bit more for the game and have lovely linen finished cards rather than know automatically if it's a Portal game I will need to buy sleeves for the cards automatcally ...I'd rather not have to sleeve my cards ...I guess it's too late now for this game but how about next years Essen release ...always assuming there is one ?
Game markers, player boards ...excellent cardboard nice an sturdy perfect thickness ...nice vibrant colours used...nice wooden pieces as well...
Rule book ...well written, well laid out and very colourful ...but too big would be much nicer A4 format ...much easier to handle...
So, over all 8/10 for components ( dropped two because of cards)

item.name: In the Year of the Dragon
item.comment: Picked this up,at Essen as wanted the dragons for a different game - turned out I brought myself one of my all time favourite games :-)

item.name: Infection: Humanity's Last Gasp
item.comment:
A very solid solitaire game ...that fits on my gaming board so I can play in bed ...not that I am lazy but suffer from a long term illness which puts me in bed a lot ...
Great the way he has created relations with the medical team or not in some ways as some Drs refusing to work with each other ...mirrors life very well !
Clever puzzle game...that could gave been dry but is not ...
Another great game from VPG I own 12 of their games now in the newish delux format and each one is a master class in great game design and fun ...they are my go to solitaire gaming company ...

item.name: Inhabit the Earth
item.comment:
This is my favourite game by Richard even supplanting his Key series for me ( only just mind you )...rules may seem intimidating at first as very dense ...but once playing it does not take long to start thinking about what to do rather than how it's done ...and boy can that hurt your brain ...although some choices can be quite obvious ...deciding what animal to optimally use when and where is key ...but as in all good games playing optimally is not always easy ...
I love the art ...but I imagine it's a bit love or hate ...
Excellent component production, thick boards, excellent card stock, and equally thick counters and tile stand ...
Don't play with those prone to AP unless you have a timer lol...

item.name: Invaders
item.comment:
Poor card stock for a card game ...print on cards and board too small...terrible choice of colours on cards icons too small...cards chipping already very poor standard compared with their previous Chapman games ...as to game play given the above I am not sure the game will be playable for me ...
Sorry WGG you dropped the ball on this one oh did I mention the awful awful art ?

item.name: Island Siege
item.comment:
Very poor dice ...labels missed cut and too small for dice face ...which has totally put me off the game ...what a shame but dice quality is an important aspect to me especially when they integral to the game and can't be replaced with better quality dice ...should have spent money on dice not coins !
I have since got four blank chesses dice the same size as the labels ...the white bleed on the stickers blends much better against the white dice background ...the dice cost me $1.50 ...these dice would have been better in this game if the publishers insisted on using sticker dice ...for a small two player game that retails at $29.99 some one has pocketed a lot of money somewhere along the line ...
The game itself rates a solid 8 for game play but rightly or wrongly I am so upset by the dice I am not going to lift the rating ...
Plus asked the publishers for new labels ...not heard a thing ...I will be very careful and really check out components of any future Ape games before or if I buy ...

item.name: Istanbul
item.comment: Solid light to medium weight game ...excellent components, well written rules and quite a decent amount of thought energy needed ...scales well ...lots of replay value as well ...

item.name: Kahuna
item.comment: A ten for me ...I have always just adored the simplicity of this game ...also I have given away at least three copies of this game as pressies and has resulted in recruiting the beneficiary into our hobby ...kahuna got them hooked long before other gate way games hit the market ...

item.name: The King's Armory
item.comment:
Waited a long time for this game ...very pleased to have it arrive ...
Sadly, and ironically as a tower defence game ...it has been badly let down by the physical towers themselves ...awful product ...
Was going to buy expansions but changed my mind now ...very disappointing ...
The rule book cover is almost as sturdy as the towers ...

item.name: König von Siam
item.comment: A little box with a lot of punch ...

item.name: Lamborghini: The Official Race Game
item.comment:
The 2 is for the board and cars the low score is for unplayable rules and terrible packaging ...
Ghenos get a grip of your rules writing as you will go out of business if u keep producing unplayable rules sets ...

item.name: Las Vegas Boulevard
item.comment: Excellent series of modular expansions for this excellent fun game ...

item.name: Legacy: The Testament of Duke de Crecy
item.comment: Another solid game from Portal games ...

item.name: Legendary Encounters: An Alien Deck Building Game
item.comment:
Best themed deck building game I have played/own so far ...
This really has hit the mark for me /us plus the addition of role changing and playing as an alien really makes this game such fun...
I also really love the play mat ...would take that over a warping board any day ...
My only tiny tiny criticism is I wish the company would not print generic card dividers but ones with card names /subject / card group etc a la resident evil etc ...
Guess it will just cost me some printer ink as some one has already created a set for printing ... Still wish the company would do it though as standard ...they are so necessary for this game given all the small and larger sub-sets in the cards it speeds up set up and put away time etc
But this minor gripe certainly does not distract from this most excellent game though ...

item.name: Legion of Honor
item.comment: Initial rating after first play ...I imagine it will only go up as I play more ...

item.name: Lewis & Clark
item.comment: Awesome game ...bit of a brain burner ...but a very solid and enjoyable design ...one of our highlights of 2013

item.name: The Lord of the Rings Dice Building Game
item.comment: The new revised rules make this the game wiz kids should have released in the first place !!! Well done Paul et alia for the work on the rule book ... The game is a descent addition to the dice building family ...

item.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game
Machi Koro
item.comment:
Stunning filler game which just plays so well and beats Splendor to the table hands down ...
Although both games are different the time and purpose I.e lite filler is similar and we turn to this game more than Splendor ...

item.name: Might & Magic Heroes
item.comment:
Solid game ...very impressive components ...
Good game over all for a license conversion ...I was a bit worried ...
Would have been rated higher if scenarios were with game or at least the meaty second scenario was translated into English please and was aimed at 2-4 players ...
Let's hope sales are enough to allow for planned expansions !!!

item.name: Mombasa
item.comment: Another first class game from PS ...PS and What's Your Game are now publishers whom I look forward to every Essen as their games achieve a consistantly high standard in both content and playability ...bravo !

item.name: Morels
item.comment:
An ok game ...not bad but not so brilliant either ...not quite sure why so many rave about this game ...having read reviews I thought this game was going to be something really out there ...having played several times I feel like I have played a game that has had so much hype is was bound not to meet expectations ...and sadly it did not !
The card art is fun and I did not get version with sticks and pans as sold out by the time I ordered it but I wish those components were standard it would have raised it another point for me ...
We prefer to play this when we too tired to play anything too deep or thinky ...

item.name: My Village
item.comment: Marvellous game ...on a par of its non-dice sister game ...refreshes the original ...multiple roads to victory so far its been very enjoyable ...although does not have the diversity of the original game with its two expansions ...although I am sure there maybe new cards in the future If this game sells well ...excellent design.

item.name: Nations
item.comment:
Marvellous game ...not sure which I prefer more this or through the ages as both a goog points and both have issues though none serious ...I am keeping both will play this with mrs f ...but would not play through the ages with her ...
I struggled with solo rules but once I was helped by geeks on this forum I got it sorted and enjoy the solitaire a huge amount now ...looking forward to the dice version !

item.name: OddVille
item.comment: Much deeper game play than it suggests ...

item.name: Omen: A Reign of War
item.comment: Just a brilliant game ...never a dull moment put in my top ten of two player card games ...

item.name: Pagoda
item.comment:
My wife and I love this game so much it's excellent arrived with me the same week as Istanbul, and Port Royal ...to be honest all three games from this publisher suffer from the same problem ...
They are all great fun, good solid games with excellent production ...
This game is the only dedicated two player of the three however the other two scale down to two player very well ...
Reminds me somewhat of the two player Kosmos series style game when they were at their zenith ...
Lite rules...loads of decision making but not subject to AP ...
I was a little worried about how well the pagodas would stand up once fully built and to be honest if you have short stubby fingers it can be a tiny bit tricky but actually they held up really well ...more rules than Port Royal but less than Istanbul all three games are fairly quick playing ...Part royal being more of a filler and Istandbul being a bit longer to play than this at two player but that's mainly because it is a longer game with more actions and decisions needed ...
Well done PS for these wonderful three games ...we love them all

item.name: Pandemic Legacy: Season 1
item.comment: Just unbelievably excellent ...tense, fun, exciting and is almost design perfection ...one of the best games I have played in forty years of being an active member of this hobby just stunning deserves a 12 ...10 not high enough ...

item.name: Paperback
item.comment:
2nd Ed
A very clever thinking persons DBG highly recommend for those who like word games and DBGS or just word games ...
Great art, excellent card stock nice linden finished cards good choice of materials for box etc ...
Must have taken some serious play testing to achieve the letter balance ...
We play with all the optional rules they are not difficult to understand but add even more variety to the games ..
In my tiny little mind beats scrabble hands down far more fun !!!!

item.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – Base Set
item.comment:
Bloody marvelous a brilliant game plays so well and can't wait to see the next five adventure packs ... I have revised down my initial 10 to a five as I now have more handwriting on my rule book than type and until a new living rules is posted it will stay at five as I am fed up of annotating my rule book ...so please Mr publisher update the rules book !
Raised up to 7 from 5 started as 10 ... almost there!!
It would be a ten if a solution to errated cards comes forth ...I would be happy with PDFs so long as I don't have to write on my cards ...new rule book a little better but still needs either a full index or glossary ...
The amount of errata will keep this at current rating ...shame so much !

item.name: Pax Pamir
item.comment: A veritable history lesson in a great game ...of the great game !

item.name: Polis: Fight for the Hegemony
item.comment: wow - brilliant - what a game - don't be put off by thin cards and rule book linguistic style...

item.name: Port Royal
item.conditiontext: What a very very entertaining push your luck card game that works so well and is full of choices and decisions ...one of the crop of three recently released Pegasus Spiel games I have just purchased this one, Pagoda and Istanbul...all three have been very very good all in different ways which is good as they are different games lol...but production for all three top notch ...

item.name: Porta Nigra
item.comment: Very good game ...played two player only but really enjoyed this game a lot ...smooth game play...good art and production ...I can see why some think this might be prone to AP with certain types of players ...keep a timer handy if you have one of those fun killers in your game group ...

item.name: Portal: The Uncooperative Cake Acquisition Game
item.comment:
A surprising antithesis to the hobby's love of cooperative games ...
Probably the best game produced by this publisher todate...

item.name: The Prodigals Club
item.comment: Solid game ...played with two ...not tried it yet combining it with last Will...but a very smooth game with lots of choices to make ...excellent production as one would expect from this very professional publisher ...

item.name: Quantum
item.comment:
What were they thinking with these dice ...mine were stuck together,covered in mold release fluid, chipped and misshapen ...terrible !
Emailed publisher for replacement dice if I ever get them will raise rating ...
I hope they use a different manufacture for Taikado delux !
Ps ...Funforge have offered to replace the dice so await there arrival ..

item.name: Rails of New England
item.comment:
A very much improved game with the new rules set ...would have been good if it had come with a decent set in first instance ...not sure how it got released with the first rule book ...
I am sure this game deserves a much better rating than it currently sits at ...
It is/ has been very well supported by designer ...
With further plays upped from 8 to 9

item.name: Rapa Nui
item.comment: Great game - don't understand the low rating for this game reminds me of some of the older good quality Kosmos two player series...

item.name: Red7
item.comment:
My go to filler card game ...absolute genius design...
We play all in ...advanced rules and odd numbered card actions ...although rules lite, and pretty much a filler for us ...it size belies its depth ...

item.name: Regnum Angelica
item.comment:
Firstly, I adore Angels bethey good or bad ...both can be useful at the right time in the right circumstance ...
A game that I picked up purely because of subject matter...deliberately ignored all reviews / rules etc I just wanted it for subject ...
And I wish I had done the loto on the same day ...
Excellent game I will do a mini review later but let me just say very very fun and deeply strategic or not depends on how you want to play it ...I play games for fun not to just win but I imagine some chess heads really getting stuck into this ...

item.name: Renaissance Wars
item.comment:
First class historical trick taking variant game ...very enjoyable...excellent production ...and worthy of many hours of play ...
One of the best rule books I have ever read ...and the card quality is top notch...in fact the whole package evokes the period the game is set in ...
The game box is hinge which opens with a set up guide in the lid and everything fits in the plastic insert with just about the right of room to not make the contents crushed up...
The game play is very well thought out and due to the variable set up each game remains fresh on each play. Lots of strategy in this game ...much of which is not immediately apparent ...
Full review to follow ...
Played ten times so far and enjoyed every game ...

item.name: The Road to Canterbury
item.comment:
Firstly, love the theme ...
Secondly, this game is a perfect example of how a game should be produced ...stunning pieces, stunning art work ...A great insert ...play aides the whole dam package is brilliant ...so well produced it should be held up as an exemplar to games publishers through out the industry ...
And finally but not least very good fun to play which works with both two and three players equally well ...

item.name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island
item.comment: The almost perfect solitaire game ...

item.name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island – Voyage of the Beagle (Vol. 1)
item.comment: Stunning...the expansion must be seen to be believed ...

item.name: Rolling Freight
item.comment: me and my gaming chums loved this game - and would play any time and some ...

item.name: Rolling Freight: Great Britain and India
item.comment:
Excellent choice of countries plus updated and clearer graphics ...
Look forward to even more maps in the future for this excellent game ...

item.name: Scoville
item.comment: Solid game design ...plays well with two ...looking forward to the expansion to spice things up a bit more ...

item.name: Seasons
item.comment: luuuve this game great fun light rules - deep thought and strategy - lots of screwage nice!!!

item.name: Serpent's Tongue
item.comment:
Awesome stuff ...want to rate 11...
Ever read any Raymond E Feist, or Brandon Sanderson this game gives you the opportunity to become a true caster of magic !!!!

item.name: Shadowrun: Crossfire
item.comment:
I own a lot of DBGs and it has become my gaming genre of choice although controversially I no longer own all my Dominion sets ...I have however decided at some point I will re purchase Dominion and all its sets if available ...mean while this game is my joint favourite DBG atm along with Aliens: Legacey...
For some reason this game has just clicked with me I play it solitaire using two characters. It has surspringly few cards compared to ther DBGs but because of the nature of the game using scenarios it still keeps it totally fresh and very challenging ...that said I would buy many many expansions at the drop of a hat ...so please print some more asap ...I need my expansion addiction feeding ...please help me !
Having played this more and more along with legendary: Encounters I have decided to raise them both to a BGG of 11 if it existed ...

item.name: Shadowrun: Crossfire – High Caliber Ops
item.comment:
Excellent expansion ...new scenarios, multicoloured cards ...well thought out abilities on cards and of course a plethora of nasty obstacles ...
Black market has some pretty tasty new goodies too..the whole expansion adds a breath of fresh air to base game, without over complicating it with too many new cards...
Alternate art starting cards are very useful and make a nice change to ones starting hand ...
The two new character role cards look interesting but not tried them yet but seem to add yet another layer of variability to this excellent but hard game ...

item.name: Shadows of Brimstone: City of the Ancients
item.comment: Awesome, awesome and awesome my game of 2014 ...

item.name: Shadows over the Empire
item.comment:
A lot of game for such a short time to play ...
Stunning art on cards ...
Plays best with two players ...

item.name: SOS Titanic
item.comment: I have rated this lite game a ten ...

item.name: Splendor
item.comment:
Simple lite filler game ...but can become a little samey after too many plays ...if the nobles had special powers this would have perhaps incentivised the players to aim towards them rather than just garner more VPs and spiced up the game play ...
Great components ...in fact almost over done !
Over all though providing it's not played too often it's a great game for those evenings when you are too tired to play anything too thinky ...

item.name: Star Trek: Expeditions
item.comment: Great game very thematic ...just really wished an expansion module was created to add a tiny bit more spice into this game ...I feel many players are being too harsh on this game !

item.name: Super Motherload
item.comment:
Wow ...I love DBG ...but this appears to be the best IDBG I have played ...
I call it an Interactive DBG ..because it truly works ...you are deck building with real game play outcomes that interact with a board that really serves a purpose in the game and that purpose adds some real tactical game play and not just something that appears tacked on ...more than just thinning ones deck of cards ...
Stronger interaction than Trains, and other DBG that claim to be more than just deck building ...
Review to come ...
But in a nutshell fantastic game, great components, nice size box ( no empty air) good rules presentation, well supported ...it is the mother-load of IDBGs...

item.name: Taj Mahal
item.comment: My fav game by this designer

item.name: Target Earth
item.comment:
Have given this a ten as it's my go to solitaire sci-fi game that I can just sit quietly and play for many hours ...something about this game just cheers me up can't explain why ...
I love the game ...admittedly it's got its warts but then it has it's shinning halos too ...

item.name: Targi
item.comment: Very strong two player game...

item.name: Tides of Time
item.comment:
It's a filler...but what an excellent filler ...played loads every time a new combo ...a new way of winning ...very quick and thoughtful at the same time ...
A great game ...and unbelievable how much game is there ...one of my all time favourite drafting games ...

item.name: Tiny Epic Defenders
item.comment:
Terrible terrible rule book ...so much missing from it, badly written
If it were not for whatch it played with Rodney Smith I would not know how to play this game ...
Faq on geek is huge tiny rule book epic faq ...
2 for components ...
Avoid until new rule book available ...

item.name: Tobago
item.comment:
Great little game ...should be in print all the time as it's a Works as a gateway game and enough to be enjoyed as a lite game for an evening session before main event ...with more serious gamers ...a hard act to achieve !
Play it frequently 2 player and it's 32 board combos make for a different experience each time ...

item.name: Trains
item.comment:
My wife even loves this game - need I say more !
Excellent card stock, very engaging game and look forward to seeing loads more boards for this game ...

item.name: Trickerion: Legends of Illusion
item.comment:
Lost for words ...an almost perfect KS ...stunning game and a new bench mark set for a KS projects...it can be done and to all those not so hot games publishers ...this is the level that you should aspire to...great customer support and the game is just absolutely wonderful ...great subject too...
We played several times over Christmas holidays and enjoyed every minute of this game ...deep thinking was required in order to perform the best shows...but boy what a journey ...one of the best WP games I have played and using the optional 2p rules made this a seriously good 2 player game. No need for dummy/robo players etc ...very impressive design...not played with the magicians duel yet ...
As soon as you have learnt basic game ...I would highly recommend getting the dark alley aspect of the game going it's adds so much to the game with hardly any new rules ...

item.name: Twilight Struggle
item.comment: A master piece ...

item.name: Unhappy King Charles!
item.comment: Owning this and the kings war satisfies my journey's back to this period of British History ...although obviously a necessary simplification of this rather complex period of the English Civil Wars ...

item.name: Urbion
item.comment: Brilliant solo game not played two player dived in with expansions after 2-3 plays but expansions just add even more in a very straight forward way ...my solo of choice for a spare 10 mins gaming very very clever design...

item.name: Village
item.comment: Raised from 8 to 10 when played with first expansion ...I expect to raise to 11 with the port expansion which looks even better than the first expansion if possible

item.name: Viticulture: Complete Collector's Edition
item.comment:
Best KS to date ...plus not forgetting the games ...Tuscany has added so much to viticulture ...
Top class product ...excellent support for the game from the designers ...

item.name: The Voyages of Marco Polo
item.comment: My euro game of the year so far 2015 ...followed by la Granja and Forge War...

item.name: The Walking Dead: The Board Game
Warhammer Quest: The Adventure Card Game
item.comment: Great game ...not complicated but a bit fiddly to learn ...

item.name: World Without End
item.comment: A very solid euro that seems to have gotten lost over the mists of time ...very enjoyable and some quite innovative use of cards etc ...

item.name: Wyatt Earp
item.comment:
My go to game if I need a rummy fix ...had this for over ten years now and never bored of it ...I always use designers variant when playing two players and raise cash limit to 35,000 in order to get three hands in ...
Components have held up very well considering age and number of times played ...

item.name: X-Files
item.comment:
I am giving this a ten because I still,play this game despite its age ...I have promos, t-shirt, play test decks etc ...I just love the theme ( obviously) and never play without using the x-files optional special powers ...underrated game based on clue ...but swamped in a deluge of other ccgs when it came out ...
This theme would make an awesome solitaire/ cooperative game Lcg if only someone clever enough would do it ...the series it still has a huge cult following even after all these years ...

item.name: XCOM: The Board Game
item.comment:
So much better than I dared hoped...
App use in this game works very well and shows that combining board and app can and does work ...as long as app is always free and always multi-platform...

item.name: Yedo
item.comment: Awesome thematic WP game ...stunning parts, delicious art work and very good rule book ...

item.name: Yggdrasil
item.comment: I just adore this game from this small company - excellent game up there with ghost stories...marvellous stuff ...

item.name: Zombie Survival: The Board Game
item.comment:
I aam zombie game fanboy and own many many zombie games and this is one of my favourites ...the updated rules go a long way to make this game more easily understood and the expansion ( a must buy ) really tackles many of the issues raised by OPs when the game first game out ...in fact one should consider it a absolute requirement to buy expansion to get the most from this game ...
I play this game solitaire all the time ...when I have the urge to play a zombie game with others out comes Zombicide ...but plays quickly, has a puzzle element and if you play the zombies on your house in the most destructive way possible can really present you with a tough challenge ...
I hope folks will play with the expansion and updated rules and see that this game is actually quite a little gem ...
